p: The total sugar content was determined by the anthrone method at 630 nm as described in [ 28]. Briefly, 200 mg fruit were extracted three times with ethanol (80%) at 80 Â°C. Then, the extracts were evaporated to dryness and redissolved in 2 mL distilled water. One millilitre of sample extracts was added to 1.5 mL of anthrone reagent (0.2% in H 2SO 4) and mixed thoroughly. The sample was brought to boil using a boiling water bath. The solution was cooled to room temperature and absorbance was measured. The formation of the blue-green complex indicates the presence of total sugars. Glucose was used as a standard. Vitamin C content was determined using the titrimetric method with 2,6-dichlorophenolindophenol described by the Association of Official Analytical Chemistry [ 29].
